item.title: Building a Smarter Planet - IT Infrastructure
item.itunes:author: IBM
item.itunes:subtitle: IT Infrastructure
item.itunes:summary: Four experts discuss IT Infrastructure - what it is delivering, new developments in functionality, and what we need to be prepared for moving forward. Listen in as Bernie Meyerson, the CTO of IBM Systems and Technology Group, Donna Dillenberger of IBM Research, Frank Gens, senior vice president and chief analyst with IDC, and James Governor, co-founder of IT analyst firm Redmonk help uncover some of the facts.
item.itunes:keywords: Redmonk, IBM, cloud computing, IT Infrastructure, CTO

item.title: Building a Smarter Planet: Traffic
item.itunes:author: IBM
item.itunes:subtitle: smarter traffic
item.itunes:summary: In the US alone, 3.7 billion hours are lost to people sitting in traffic each year, and 2.3 billion gallons of fuel burn needlessly at a cost of 78 billion dollars per year. We are contributing to environmental waste, and to our stress levels, in very negative ways. So what are some of the solutions being put in place to help sort this all out?

item.title: IBM and the Future of Indian Retail
item.itunes:author: IBM
item.itunes:subtitle: Future of Indian Retail
item.itunes:summary: India has emerged as the fifth largest retail destination worldwide and expected to be a $427 billion industry by 2010. This podcast looks at how the industry would shape up over the next five years and the opportunities that retailers will look to explore.

item.title: IBM and the Future of Baseball
item.itunes:author: IBM
item.itunes:subtitle: Future of Baseball
item.itunes:summary: How does sabermetrics, the analysis of statistics, impact the performance of professional sports teams, and how can the science be applied to business.

item.title: IBM and the Future of Energy
item.itunes:author: IBM
item.itunes:subtitle: Future of Energy
item.itunes:summary: The next five years will be pivotal for the energy and utility industry. Consumers are no longer content to be recipients of energy, they want more choices about how they buy it, how they manage it, and the impact energy production has on the environment.

item.title: IBM and the Future of Low Carbon Business
item.itunes:author: IBM
item.itunes:subtitle: Future of Low Carbon Business
item.itunes:summary: Hearst Corporation built a New York City skyscraper that recycles its rainwater from the roof to heat and cool the building. Its Cafe 57 offers sustainable fish entrees and one of the largest organic salad bars. Listen to how its serving as a model for low carbon business.

item.title: IBM and the Future of Golf
item.itunes:author: IBM
item.itunes:subtitle: USGA
item.itunes:summary: Pete Bevequa, USGA Chief Business Officer, discusses the possible impacts of technology and innovation in helping grow the game of Golf.

item.title: IBM and the Future of Water Management
item.itunes:author: IBM
item.itunes:subtitle: Water management
item.itunes:summary: With climate change gaining wider understanding, the issue of coastal flooding due to rising sea levels and extreme weather episodes is high on the agenda of many governments worldwide.

item.title: IBM and the Future of Movies
item.itunes:author: IBM
item.itunes:subtitle: Future of Movies
item.itunes:summary: With technology enabling consumers demand for more customization on how they enjoy entertainment, how are the movie studios adapting their strategy? How are content providers adjusting to new web-based distribution channels such as YouTube?

item.title: IBM and the Future of Data Security
item.itunes:author: IBM
item.itunes:subtitle: data security
item.itunes:summary: With so many high profile security breaches in the news, how do organizations evaluate the economics of protecting their customers' data, including the Payment Card Industry (PCI) compliance mandates?

item.title: IBM and the Future of the Mobile Phone.
item.itunes:author: IBM
item.itunes:subtitle: future of mobile phone
item.itunes:summary: Over the coming years, mobile phones are expected to get "smarter," adjusting to our usage patterns. Innovations such as larger projectable screens and other e-commerce and social networking features will enable the phone to provide much more value to our lives.

item.title: IBM and the Future of Smart IT
item.itunes:author: IBM
item.itunes:subtitle: Future of Smart IT
item.itunes:summary: With computing data centers consuming an alarming amount of electricity and expected to grow dramatically each year, organizations are turning to Smart IT to reduce consumption by up to 40 percent.
item.itunes:keywords: futureof, IBM, SmartIT, datacenter, green, esty,

item.title: IBM and the Future of Shopping
item.itunes:author: Tim Washer
item.itunes:subtitle: Future of Shopping
item.itunes:summary: By the end of 2008, the web is expected to garner 20 percent of the total retail spend. Retailers must evolve both their physical and online stores with innovations such as endless aisles and mobile checkout; and tightly integrate the channels to create an enhanced shopping experience that will drive customer advocacy.

item.title: IBM and the Future of Microfinance
item.itunes:author: Tim Washer
item.itunes:subtitle: Future of Microfinance
item.itunes:summary: Two thirds of the world's population earns less than $5 a day. Among the many efforts to alleviate global poverty, one of the most promising is microfinance. As of last year, there were 3,100 microfinance institutions providing services to over 100 million people with a gross loan portfolio exceeding US$23 billion. Listen to a discussion on how these $100 loans are driving entrepreneurship and helping to build a new economy.

item.title: IBM and the Future of Africa
item.itunes:author: Tim Washer
item.itunes:subtitle: Future of Africa
item.itunes:summary: Just a decade ago, economists would have scoffed at predictions of steady, 5% growth rate for the continent. Today, the conversation around Africa is changing dramatically. In the last four years, the number of wireless subscribers in Africa has skyrocketed from 10 million to more than 200 million. So what are the implications of these new realities for the continent?

item.title: IBM and the Future of Medical Imaging
item.itunes:author: Tim Washer
item.itunes:subtitle: Evolution of the x-ray
item.itunes:summary: What if algorithms from the high-resolution gaming industry and analytics from oil exploration were applied to the field of medical imaging? Using supercomputers to integrate data from multiple sources and display it in a 3D representation could help doctors improve the accuracy of diagnoses, while reducing costs to make these advancements available to more patients.
